text.0: pleasant to indras mitras pūṣans bhagas taste sped onward soma with thy flowing stream.
text.1: let indra drink o soma of thy juice for wisdom and all deities for strength.
text.2: so flow thou on as bright celestial juice flow to the vast immortal dwellingplace.
text.3: flow onward soma as a mighty sea as father of the gods to every form.
text.4: flow on o soma radiant for the gods and heaven and earth and bless our progeny.
text.5: thou bright juice art sustainer of the sky flow mighty in accordance with true law.
text.6: soma flow splendid with thy copious stream through the great fleece as in the olden time.
text.7: bom led by men joyous and purified let the lightfinder make all blessings flow.
text.8: indu while cleansed keeping the people safe shall give us all possessions for our own.
text.9: flow on for wisdom soma and for power as a strong courser bathed to win the prize.
text.10: the pressers purify this juice of thine the soma for delight and lofty fame.
text.11: they deck the goldhued infant newlyborn even soma indu in the sieve for gods.
text.12: fair indu hath flowed on for rapturous joy sage for good fortune in the waters lap.
text.13: he bears the beauteous name of indra that wherewith he overcame all demon foes.
text.14: all deities are wont to drink of him pressed by the men and blent with milk and curds.
text.15: he hath flowed forth with thousand streams effused flowed ihsough the filter and the sheeps long wool.
text.16: with endless genial flow the strong hath run purified by the waters blent with milk.
text.17: pressed out with stones directed by the men go fortli o soma into indras throat.
text.18: the mighty soma with a thousand streams is poured to indra through the cleansing sieve.
text.19: indu they balm with pleasant milky juice for indra for the steer for his delight.
text.20: lightly for sheen they cleanse thee for the gods goldcoloured wearing water as thy robe.
text.21: indu to indra streams yea downward streams strong flowing to the floods and mingling there.
